author: Adurai Bureau
text:
Over 27,900 students in Dindigul, and 17,400 in Theni appear

Students appearing for SSLC examinations in Dindigul on Tuesday.— PHOTO: G. Karthikeyan

More than 27,900 students in Dindigul and 17,400 students in Theni districts appeared for the SSLC examination on Tuesday.

Collector T.N. Hariharan inspected the arrangements at a centre in Dindigul city. Elaborate arrangements had been made in all the 94 examination centres in the district. A total of 1,170 private candidates also appeared for the exam. Around 167 flying squads, 94 principal supervisors, 12 question paper controllers, 11 special inspectors, 1,599 room supervisors were deployed to conduct the exam.

Theni

Regular candidates in 195 schools wrote the examinations in 60 centres and private candidates in five centres.

Elaborate arrangements had been made in the examination centres.

Collector N. Venkatachalam inspected a centre in Theni.

Virudhunagar

Public examination for tenth standard began here on Tuesday with 29,722 students appearing for the Tamil first paper.

A total of 15,607 girls and 14,115 boys from 336 schools in three educational districts of Virudhunagar, Aruppukottai and Srivilliputtur districts took the examinations in 100 centres. The examination would conclude on April 13.

The Virudhunagar Collector, V. Rajaraman, inspected the arrangements made at the Virudhunagar Kshatriya Girls Higher Secondary School.

A statement from the Collector said that 150 flying squads had been formed to prevent malpractices during the examination.
title: Flying squads keep vigil as students write SSLC exams
